refnamediv.refpurpose: Amanda Application to interface with PostgreSQL

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Ampgsql is an &A; Application API script. It should not be run by users directly. It implements on-line backups of PostgreSQL databases in conjunction with WAL archiving.

refsect1.title: PROPERTIES
refsect1.para: This section lists the amanda.conf5 properties that control ampsql's functionality. See amanda-applications7 for information on application properties and how they are configured.

varlistentry.listitem: Path to the GNU tar executable.
Directory for saving state about backups already made.
Directory to use for temporary files during the backup process. It should have enough space to store a complete copy of the database.

refsect1.title: CLIENT PROPERTIES
refsect1.para: This section lists the amanda-client.conf5 properties that control ampsql's functionality. If a property is prefixed with the diskname and an underscore, then it will be used when that diskname is being backed up. For example, if the properties PG_DATA and foo_PG_DATA are set, the value of PG_DATA will be used when bar and baz are being backed up, but foo_PG_DATA will be used when foo is being backed up. Disknames are specified in the disklist5.

varlistentry.listitem: Directory that WAL sement files are archived to, as specified by the archive_command in PosgreSQL's postgresql.conf .
Database to connect to. Defaults to "template1" (which exists by default)
Host to connect to. If it starts with "/" it will be interepreted as a directory that holds the socket file. PostgreSQL defaults to /tmp

Connect using the creditials in this file. Each line should have the format "hostname:port:database:username:password". The permissions must permit it to be read only by the user, or the file will not be used. Only usable with Postgres 8.1 and up.
Password to use when connecting. Deprecated in favor of passfiles.
The TCP port to connect to, or the suffix of the socket file. PostgreSQL defaults to 5432.
User to connect as. It must be a superuser.
Path to the psql binary. If not specified, /usr/bin/psql or /usr/local/bin/psql will be used (in that order).
